title: Dmitry Oboznenko
text:
Dmitry Georgievich Oboznenko (; July 10, 1930, Leningrad, USSR – June 19, 2002, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation) was a Soviet Russian painter, graphic artist, <a href="Honored%20Artist%20of%20the%20RSFSR">Honored Artist of the RSFSR</a> who lived and worked in <a href="Saint%20Petersburg">Saint Petersburg</a>. He was a member of the <a href="Saint%20Petersburg%20Union%20of%20Artists">Saint Petersburg Union of Artists</a> (before 1992 – the Leningrad branch of Union of Artists of Russian Federation), regarded as a representative of the <a href="Leningrad%20School%20of%20Painting">Leningrad school of painting</a>, most famous for his genre compositions and combat paintings of the siege of Stalingrad. He was a noted poster and caricature artist, a member of The Fighting Pencil Group.
Biography.
Dmitry Georgievich Oboznenko was born July 10, 1930 in the Leningrad, USSR. In 1951 he entered at the first course of painting department of the <a href="Repin%20Institute%20of%20Arts">Leningrad Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture named after Ilya Repin</a>. He studied of <a href="Vladimir%20Gorb">Vladimir Gorb</a>, Valery Pimenov, Vitaly Valtsev, <a href="Rudolf%20Frentz">Rudolf Frentz</a>.
In 1957, Dmitry Oboznenko graduated from <a href="Repin%20Institute%20of%20Arts">Leningrad Institute of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture</a> in Josef Serebriany workshop. His graduation work was painting named "Nightingales", devoted to the memory of soldiers of the Great Patriotic War (1941–1945).
Since 1957 Dmitry Oboznenko has participated in Art Exhibitions. He painted portraits, genre and battle paintings, landscapes, sketches from the life. He worked in oil painting, pencil drawings, watercolors, and satiric posters. The most important paintings that brought recognition of Dmitry Oboznenko, were devoted to the theme of the Great Patriotic War, the image of the Russian soldier, a moral victory in the confrontation of cruelty and evil. In 1978 Dmitry Oboznenko was awarded the honorary title of <a href="Honored%20Artist%20of%20the%20RSFSR">Honored Artist of the RSFSR</a>.
Dmitry Oboznenko was a member of the <a href="Saint%20Petersburg%20Union%20of%20Artists">Saint Petersburg Union of Artists</a> (before 1992 – the <a href="Leningrad%20branch%20of%20Union%20of%20Artists%20of%20Russian%20Federation">Leningrad branch of Union of Artists of Russian Federation</a> since 1957.
Dmitry Georgievich Oboznenko died in <a href="Saint%20Petersburg">Saint Petersburg</a> in 2002. Paintings by Dmitry Oboznenko reside in <a href="State%20Russian%20Museum">State Russian Museum</a>, <a href="Tretyakov%20Gallery">State Treryakov Gallery</a>, in Art museums and private collections in Russia, England, in the U.S., China, Ukraine, Italy, Japan, France, and other countries.
